pv3199.util

Class DirectedGraph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • pv3199.util.Graph<T>
      • pv3199.util.DirectedGraph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - The type of vertex that the graph will hold.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class DirectedGraph<T>
extends Graph<T>
    Directed graph of vertices. Various graph-theory properties and calculations are provided, such as cycles and path lengths.
    Author:
    Vishal Patel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Vertex used for a directed graph that "points" towards other vertices.

      DirectedGraph()
      Constructs a DirectedGraph object, initializing the vertices in this graph to an empty list and the adjacency matrix to a 0x0 int array.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(T vertex,
                   T... links)
        Adds a vertex to the graph along with a set of vertices, if any, that this vertex points to. If this vertex points to a vertex (or vertices) that does not exist on the graph, then it will be added as a new vertex with no links and then this vertex will point to this newly created vertex.
        Specified by:
        add in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex to add.
        links - - the set of vertices that vertex will point to.
        Returns:
        - false if the vertex to add is null; true otherwise indicating a successful addition of the vertex.

      • add0

        private boolean add0(T vertex,
                     ArrayList<T> links)
        Adds a vertex to the graph along with a set of vertices, if any, that this vertex points to. If this vertex points to a vertex (or vertices) that does not exist on the graph, then it will be added as a new vertex with no links and then this vertex will point to this newly created vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex to add.
        links - - the set of vertices that vertex will point to.
        Returns:
        - false if the vertex to add is null; true otherwise indicating a successful addition of the vertex.

      • updateAdjacencyMatrix

        protected void updateAdjacencyMatrix()
        Description copied from class: Graph
        Updates the adjacency matrix. Should be called directly after one modification or a series of modifications are applied to the grid.
        Overrides:
        updateAdjacencyMatrix in class Graph<T>

      • remove

        public boolean remove(T vertex)
        Description copied from class: Graph
        Removes a vertex from the graph and in the process removes all pointers to it. If a graph contains the vertices {A, B, C} and the edges {AB, AC, BC, CA, CB} and the vertex {A} is removed from the graph, then the remaining edges are {BC, CB}
        Specified by:
        remove in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex to remove.
        Returns:
        false if the vertex is null or is not in the graph; true otherwise.

      • set

        public boolean set(T vertex,
                   T... links)
        Description copied from class: Graph
        Sets the links for a certain vertex. All previous links for this vertex are erased and replaced with the links specified by the parameter links.
        Specified by:
        set in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex's links to change
        links - - the new links
        Returns:
        false if the vertex is null or is not plotted on the graph; true otherwise.

      • pathLength

        public long pathLength(int n)

        Paths are NOT simple and all paths are based upon the links that each vertex has. Traveling back to the same node requires either a two-way link between that node and another node or a one-way link between another node to that node.

        Specified by:
        pathLength in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        n - - the path length to look for.
        Returns:
        -1 if an error is caught; the amount of different paths of a given length otherwise.

      • pathLength

        public boolean pathLength(T vertex,
                          int n)

        Paths are NOT simple and all paths from vertex are based upon the links that vertex has. Traveling back to vertex requires either a two-way link between vertex and another node in the graph or a one-way link between another node* to vertex.

        Specified by:
        pathLength in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex to traverse from.
        n - - the path length
        Returns:
        true if this vertex has a certain path length to another vertex.

      • pathLength

        public boolean pathLength(T originVertex,
                          T targetVertex,
                          int n)

        Paths are NOT simple and all paths from originVertex to targetVertex are based upon the adjacency matrix of the graph raised to the power of n:

        (Mg)n

        Where g represents this graph, M represents the adjacency matrix for this graph, and n is the path length to find.

        Specified by:
        pathLength in class Graph<T>
        Parameters:
        originVertex - - the first/origin vertex
        targetVertex - - the second/target vertex
        n - - the path length
        Returns:
        false if:
        • the origin vertex or the target vertex is null
        • the origin vertex or the target vertex is not plotted on the graph
        • the path length is less than 1, in which case:
          • if the path length is 0 and the origin vertex is NOT the same as the target vertex
          • or the path length is negative
        • there is no path of the desired length from the origin vertex to the target vertex

      • cycle

        public List<List<T>> cycle(T vertex)
        Determines all different cycles for a certain vertex on the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex to cycle from.
        Returns:
        null if the specified vertex is null or not in the graph; otherwise a set of cycles for this vertex in a list of list of vertex form, where each list in this list represents a cycle for this vertex.

      • cycle0

        private int cycle0(Graph.Vertex vertex,
                   Graph.Vertex cycleVertex,
                   List<List<Graph.Vertex>> cycleList,
                   List<Graph.Vertex> path)
        Helper method for cycle(Object). Recursively passes through each vertex in the graph and seeks out every unique cycle from a given vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the vertex currently being looked at.
        cycleVertex - - the vertex to cycle from.
        cycleList - - the list of cycles from cycleVertex.
        path - - the current path that this method is currently pursuing.
        Returns:
        the number of unique cycles from cycleVertex.
